frameDefinitions: A perceptible Figure shows up against a Ground location due to Light shining on/from it, its salience possibly dependent on a Cause_of_shine.
A Host is judged regarding their attitude as a potential host in a guest-host relationship.
This frame is about Items in the state of occupying a certain Rank within a hierarchy.
This frame contains nouns denoting a rank or level within an established hierarchy.
This frame contains words referring to teaching and the participants in teaching.
A member or members of a Class have just been  mentioned or are present in the discourse setting and now a different instance  (or group of instances) of the same class is referred to.
frameExamples: I found the board to be very <t>hospitable</t> to Russian graduates.
He <t>ranks</t> second in his class in mathematics.
Dad <t>taught</t> me that if you work hard, you will be OK - no matter what happens.
My husband left me for <t>another</t> woman -- and now wants to get back together again!
listRoleDefinitions: The percept which is perceived at a certain <fen>Ground</fen> location.
The location of the phenomenon.
The <fen>Light</fen> which is emitted.  In this frame, it is usually incorporated in verbs and adjectives, and is the denotation of many of the nouns.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Figure</fen> is observed against the <fen>Ground</fen> location due to <fen>Light</fen> shining on it.
The spatial setting in which the <fen>Figure</fen> shows up against a <fen>Ground</fen> location.
The <fen>Host</fen> is the person whose <fen>Behavior</fen> towards others as a (potential) host is evaluated.
The <fen>Guest</fen> is the entity which is positively or negatively treated by the <fen>Host</fen>.
The <fen>Behavior</fen> is the action of the <fen>Host</fen> on which the evaluation of the <fen>Host</fen>'s character is based.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the situation or person that the <fen>Host</fen>'s <fen>Behavior</fen> responds to or is related to.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part which indicates the character of the <fen>Host</fen>.
The individual whose point of view is taken in assigning the evaluation.
The <fen>Rank</fen> which the <fen>Item</fen> occupies.
The Item which occupies the Rank in the hierarchy.
The dimension along which the ranking is defined.
The time at which/period over which the <fen>Item</fen> occupies the <fen>Rank</fen>
The Rank itself, usually denoted by the noun.
An entity which holds a particular <fen>Rank</fen>.
One who instructs a <fen>Student</fen> in some area of knowledge or skill.
One who is instructed by a <fen>Teacher</fen> in skills or knowledge.
An educational establishment, such as a school or college.
The area of knowledge or skill which is taught by a <fen>Teacher</fen> or to a <fen>Student</fen>.
A formal Qualification such as an academic degree or a certificate for which a student is aiming.
An action which the <fen>Student</fen> is able to perform as a result of instruction.
A guideline for correct behavior. In most cases, this concerns morally or socially desirable actions.
A piece of information that the <fen>Student</fen> is informed of by the <fen>Teacher</fen>.
Educational <fen>Material</fen>, such as books, tapes, or videos, used by a <fen>Teacher</fen> or a <fen>Student</fen> to acquire skills or knowledge.
A role, typically professional or vocational,  that the <fen>Student</fen> is meant to be able to fill as a result of their training.
FN: a program of lectures or other matter dealing with a subject
The time when the teaching occurs.

The <fen>Place</fen> is the location within which the teaching takes place.

Consider whether a possible <fen>Place</fen> phrase is really where the training took place or is rather part of a description of the <fen>Institution</fen>.
The general category of entity which has been referred to.
The instance of the <fen>Class</fen> that is added to the <fen>Initial_set</fen> of entities in the <fen>Class</fen>.
The previously mentioned group of entities of the <fen>Class</fen>.
listRoleExamples: Hot coals glowed <fex>behind the fire grate</fex>.
<fex>In the morning</fex> the grass glistened with dew
<fex>Outside</fex> something was shimmering on the shore.
He ranks second in his class <fex>in mathematics</fex>.
Jim ranked as thirty-second degree Mason <fex>in 1970</fex>.
Taut with worry, Dad taught us <fex>how to drive</fex>.
My brother taught me <fex>not to be mean to guys when I'm not interested in them</fex>.
When I was two she taught me <fex>that a quarter was 25 cents and a dime was 10 cents</fex>.
All employees have received <fex>a booklet</fex> INSTRUCTING them on how to report ` anything from unwanted touching and uncalled-for blue jokes to overt demands for sexual favours . '
When his father died he went to live with an uncle in Ka'u who trained him <fex>as a warrior</fex> during his teenage years
My Husband left me for another <fex>man</fex>!
A further five incursions <fex>over and above those noted for 1995</fex> took place in the first three months of 1996.

passageCandidateSpans.text: Centers of Excellence and Centers of Development
the Federation of Accrediting Agencies of the Philippines

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Federation of Accrediting Agencies of the Philippines
the Commission on Higher Education (CHED) Technical Working Group
the Technical Education and Skills Development Authority
the Center for Educational Research and Development
Office for International Relations and Programs
the Philippine Association of Colleges and Universities Commission on Accreditation (PACUCOA)
the Philippine Higher Education Research Network
